alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Deaf Smith; Hartley; Hutchinson; Moore; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 15 at 2:55PM CST until February 15 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR PORTIONS OF THE TEXAS PANHANDLE... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Wednesday afternoon through Wednesday evening. * Affected Area...In Texas...Hartley...Moore...Hutchinson... Oldham...Potter...Carson...Deaf Smith...Randall...Armstrong and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * Relative Humidity...Today...As low as 6 percent. Wednesday...As low as 10 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...Today...4 to 7. Wednesday...4-5. * Timing...Today...11 am to 8 pm. Wednesday...Noon to 7 pm.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
